task.title: Validating WS-I Web service traffic compliance

titlealts.searchtitle: Validating WS-I Web service traffic compliance

task.shortdesc: As well as setting the level of WS-I compliance during Web services creation, you can validate WS-I compliance of the SOAP traffic a Web service produces through the TCP/IP Monitor.

taskbody.prereq:
Prerequisites: Before you can use the validation tool to ensure that your Web service SOAP traffic is WS-I compliant, you must have completed the following steps:
Generate a Web service.
Validate the WSDL that is produced.
Generate a Proxy and a sample application.
Set up the TCP/IP Monitor. Ensure that your Web service sample application traffic is directed through the TCP/IP Monitor.

context.p: To validate your Web service, complete the following steps:

step.cmd: Invoke a method in your Web service sample application to generate traffic through the TCP/IP Monitor.
To ensure that your Web service SOAP traffic is WS-I compliant, you can generate a log file by clicking the icon.
In the dialog box that opens, select a name for the log file and specify where you want it to be stored.

taskbody.result: This log file will show whether or not messages sent to and from your Web service are WS-I compliant, and list any non-compliant elements. You can open the log file in an XML editor to examine its contents.
